metadata.feature_description: Handles module installation, uninstallation, and version upgrades through manifest configuration.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify module version display in Extensions list

steps.expected: Extensions page should load with installed extensions list
steps.actual: Extensions page loaded successfully with list of installed modules

steps.expected: Libraries should be displayed including Evoq.PersonaBar.UI
steps.actual: Libraries list displayed with Evoq.PersonaBar.UI showing version 10.1.1

steps.action: Click on Evoq.PersonaBar.UI to view details
steps.expected: Extension details page should show package information
steps.actual: Extension details displayed with Name, Friendly Name, Version (10.01.01), Owner, Organization, URL, and Email fields

steps.action: Navigate to License tab in extension details
steps.actual: License tab showed DotNetNuke copyright information with Accept License checkbox

steps.action: Navigate to Release Notes tab in extension details
steps.actual: Release Notes tab showed message: 'There are no release notes for this version.'

steps.expected: Upload dialog should appear with file drop zone
steps.actual: Install Extension dialog appeared with 'Upload Extension Package' heading, file drop zone, and progress indicator '-- 1 of 5 --'

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify PersonaBar extensions list with edit/delete actions

steps.expected: PersonaBar extensions should be listed with action icons
steps.actual: 20 PersonaBar extensions displayed with version 10.1.1, Update links, and edit/delete action icons

steps.expected: Each row should have edit and delete icons
steps.actual: Extensions showed edit (pencil) and delete (trash) icons; some core extensions only showed edit icon

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test Available Extensions tab and Install wizard

steps.expected: Available extensions should be listed with Install and Download buttons
steps.actual: Available Extensions tab showed Google Tag Manager Connector (10.1.1) with Install and Download buttons

steps.action: Click Install button for an available extension
steps.expected: Installation wizard should start showing package information
steps.actual: Install wizard displayed step 2 of 5 with Package Information showing extension type (Connector), name, version, owner, and organization

steps.expected: Release notes step should be displayed
steps.actual: Release Notes step (3 of 5) displayed with message about no release notes

steps.expected: License acceptance step should be displayed
steps.actual: License step (4 of 5) displayed MIT License with Accept License checkbox; Next button disabled until license accepted

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Azure compatibility mode in manifest

steps.expected: azureCompatible element should be set to true
steps.actual: Manifest file contains <azureCompatible>true</azureCompatible> confirming Azure compatibility
Manifest defines assembly components including Dnn.PersonaBar.UI.dll and Dnn.PersonaBar.Library.dll in bin path

steps.expected: SQL scripts should be versioned for upgrades
steps.actual: Manifest defines multiple versioned SQL scripts: Install.SqlDataProvider (01.00.00), 01.01.00, 01.03.00, 01.04.00, 01.05.00, 09.04.01, and Uninstall.SqlDataProvider

observations: The manifest file shows the module version is 09.13.09 in the source code, but displays as 10.1.1 in the UI - this is expected as the UI reflects the installed package version.
Dependencies element in manifest is empty (<dependencies/>), indicating no explicit package dependencies required.
The manifest defines upgrade versions list: 01.00.00, 01.04.00, 03.00.00 which triggers UpgradeModule event for those versions.
Config component in manifest handles web.config modifications for PersonaBarModule HTTP module registration.
Uninstall.SqlDataProvider script properly drops all PersonaBar-related stored procedures, views, and tables.

Delete action icons are visible on some extensions but clicking them navigates to edit view in current implementation - uninstall may require different workflow or be restricted for system extensions.
